meanings.definition: A person connected with but not belonging to an organization or institution.
meanings.sent1: The externs at the hospital help with paperwork and assist the staff.
meanings.sent2: The company hired externs to gain fresh perspectives on their projects.
meanings.sent3: The externs accidentally mixed up the patient files, causing a bit of chaos.
meanings.sent4: She felt like an extern in her own family, always on the outside looking in.
meanings.sent5: The externs were like puzzle pieces, fitting into the organization seamlessly.

meanings.sent1: The company will externs the new product samples to potential clients.
meanings.sent2: Please externs these documents to the appropriate department for review.
meanings.sent3: He decided to externs his old belongings to make space for the new ones.
meanings.sent4: The strong winds will externs the leaves from the trees, creating a colorful carpet.
meanings.sent5: She will externs the invitations to the party guests this afternoon.
